newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey says killed five Kurdish rebels in clashes.
newsitem.headline: Turkey says killed five Kurdish rebels in clashes.

text.p: Turkish security forces have killed five Kurdish guerrillas in clashes in the southeast of the country, the emergency rule governor's office said on Friday.
In a statement, it said five Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) rebels were killed on Wednesday in Bingol province. It did not refer to any military casualties.
Turkish army helicopters on Thursday launched an offensive against rebel positions in the mountainous eastern province of Tunceli, security officials said. No casualties were reported so far.

Fighting in the rugged countryside of the mainly Kurdish eastern and southeastern provinces often increases in March when snow begins to melt. The rebels abducted a civilian at a roadblock on a main artery through the mountains earlier this week, officials said.
More than 21,000 people have died in the PKK's 12-year-old armed struggle with the military for self-rule in southeast Turkey.
